title: MailChimp
description: Create plugins that connect MailChimp to your CMS, your blog, your e-commerce shopping cart, and more.

actions.title: _method_templates.get
actions.description: Retrieve various templates available in the system, allowing some thing similar to our template gallery to be created.

types.description: The types of templates to return. See options: "http://apidocs.mailchimp.com/api/1.3/templates.func.php"

category.description: For Gallery templates only, limit to a specific template category.

inactives.description: Options to control how inactive templates are returned, if at all. See options: "http://apidocs.mailchimp.com/api/1.3/templates.func.php"

dc.description: the portion after the dash in your api key. e.g. "us1", "us2", "uk1", etc.

apikey.description: a valid api key for your user account.

method.description: is the method name from our api you are calling.

actions.title: _method_templateUpdate.get
actions.description: Replace the content of a user template, NOT campaign content.

id.description: The id of the user template to update.

values.description: The values to updates. See options: "http://apidocs.mailchimp.com/api/1.3/templateupdate.func.php"

dc.description: the portion after the dash in your api key. e.g. "us1", "us2", "uk1", etc.

apikey.description: a valid api key for your user account.

method.description: is the method name from our api you are calling.

actions.title: _method_templateAdd.get
actions.description: Create a new user template, NOT campaign content. These templates can then be applied while creating campaigns.

name.description: The name for the template - names must be unique and a max of 50 bytes.

html.description: A string specifying the entire template to be created. This is NOT campaign content.

apikey.description: a valid api key for your user account.

actions.description: Retrieve a list of all MailChimp API Keys for this User.

expired.description: Whether or not to include expired keys.

apikey.description: a valid api key for your user account.

actions.title: _method_lists.get
actions.description: Retrieve all of the lists defined for your user account.

filters.description: A hash of filters to apply to this query. See options: "http://apidocs.mailchimp.com/api/1.3/lists.func.php"

start.description: Control paging of lists, start results at this list #, defaults to 1st page of data (page 0).

limit.description: Control paging of lists, number of lists to return with each call, defaults to 25 (max=100).

dc.description: the portion after the dash in your api key. e.g. "us1", "us2", "uk1", etc.

apikey.description: a valid api key for your user account.

actions.description: Delete an existing Webhook URL from a given list.

actions.title: _method_listWebhookAdd.get
actions.description: Add a new Webhook URL for the given list.

url.description: A valid URL for the Webhook - it will be validated. note that a url may only exist on a list once.

actions.description: A hash of actions to fire this Webhook. See options: "http://apidocs.mailchimp.com/api/1.3/listwebhookadd.func.php"

sources.description: A hash of sources to fire this Webhook. See options: "http://apidocs.mailchimp.com/api/1.3/listwebhookadd.func.php"

actions.title: _method_listUpdateMember.get
actions.description: Edit the email address, merge fields, and interest groups for a list member.

email_address.description: The current email address of the member to update OR the "id" for the member returned from listMemberInfo, Webhooks, and Campaigns.

merge_vars.description: Array of new field values to update the member with. See options: "http://apidocs.mailchimp.com/api/1.3/listsubscribe.func.php"

email_type.description: Change the email type preference for the member. Leave blank to keep the existing preference (optional).

replace_interests.description: Flag to determine whether we replace the interest groups with the updated groups provided, or we add the provided groups to the member's interest groups.

dc.description: the portion after the dash in your api key. e.g. "us1", "us2", "uk1", etc.

apikey.description: a valid api key for your user account.

method.description: is the method name from our api you are calling.

actions.title: _method_listUnsubscribe.get
actions.description: Unsubscribe the given email address from the list.

email_address.description: The email address to unsubscribe OR the email "id" returned from listMemberInfo, Webhooks, and Campaigns.

delete_member.description: Flag to completely delete the member from your list instead of just unsubscribing.

send_goodbye.description: Flag to send the goodbye email to the email address.

send_notify.description: Flag to send the unsubscribe notification email to the address defined in the list email notification settings.

dc.description: the portion after the dash in your api key. e.g. "us1", "us2", "uk1", etc.

apikey.description: a valid api key for your user account.

method.description: is the method name from our api you are calling.

actions.title: _method_listSubscribe.get
actions.description: Subscribe the provided email to a list. By default this sends a confirmation email.

merge_vars.description: Merges for the email (FNAME, LNAME, etc.). See options: "http://apidocs.mailchimp.com/api/1.3/listsubscribe.func.php"

email_type.description: Email type preference for the email.

double_optin.description: Flag to control whether a double opt-in confirmation message is sent, defaults to true. Abusing this may cause your account to be suspended.

update_existing.description: Flag to control whether existing subscribers should be updated instead of throwing an error.

replace_interests.description: Flag to determine whether we replace the interest groups with the groups provided or we add the provided groups to the member's interest groups.

send_welcome.description: If your double_optin is false and this is true, we will send your lists Welcome Email if this subscribe succeeds - this will *not* fire if we end up updating an existing subscriber. If double_optin is true, this has no effect.

dc.description: the portion after the dash in your api key. e.g. "us1", "us2", "uk1", etc.

apikey.description: a valid api key for your user account.

method.description: is the method name from our api you are calling.

actions.title: _method_listMembers.get
actions.description: Get all of the list members for a list that are of a particular status.

since.description: Pull all members whose status (subscribed/unsubscribed/cleaned) has changed or whose profile (updated) has changed since this date/time (in GMT) - format is YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm:ss (24hr).

start.description: For large data sets, the page number to start at - defaults to 1st page of data (page 0).

limit.description: For large data sets, the number of results to return - defaults to 100, upper limit set at 15000.

For backwards compatibility, if a string is passed, it will be treated as an array with a single element (will not work with XML-RPC).

actions.title: _method_listInterestGroupingAdd.get
actions.description: Add a new Interest Grouping - if interest groups for the List are not yet enabled, adding the first grouping will automatically turn them on.

name.description: The interest grouping to add - grouping names must be unique.

type.description: The type of the grouping to add.

groups.description: The lists of initial group names to be added - at least 1 is required and the names must be unique within a grouping. If the number takes you over the 60 group limit, an error will be thrown.

emails.description: Array of email addresses to unsubscribe.

delete_member.description: Flag to completely delete the member from your list instead of just unsubscribing.

send_goodbye.description: Flag to send the goodbye email to the email addresses.

actions.title: _method_listBatchSubscribe.get
actions.description: Subscribe a batch of email addresses to a list at once.

batch.description: An array of structs for each address to import with two special keys: "EMAIL" for the email address, and "EMAIL_TYPE" for the email type option (html, text, or mobile).

double_optin.description: Flag to control whether to send an opt-in confirmation email.

update_existing.description: Flag to control whether to update members that are already subscribed to the list or to return an error.

replace_interests.description: Flag to determine whether we replace the interest groups with the updated groups provided, or we add the provided groups to the member's interest groups.

actions.title: _method_generateText.get
actions.description: Have HTML content auto-converted to a text-only format. You can send: plain HTML, an array of Template content, an existing Campaign Id, or an existing Template Id. Note that this will not save anything to or update any of your lists, campaigns, or templates.

type.description: The type of content to parse.

content.description: The content to use. For "html" expects a single string value, "template" expects an array like you send to campaignCreate, "url" expects a valid and public URL to pull from, "cid" expects a valid Campaign Id, and "tid" expects a valid Template Id on your account.

actions.title: _method_campaigns.get
actions.description: Get the list of campaigns and their details matching the specified filters.

filters.description: A hash of filters to apply to this query. See options: "http://apidocs.mailchimp.com/api/1.3/campaigns.func.php"

start.description: Control paging of campaigns, start results at this campaign #, defaults to 1st page of data (page 0).

limit.description: Control paging of campaigns, number of campaigns to return with each call, defaults to 25 (max=1000).

dc.description: the portion after the dash in your api key. e.g. "us1", "us2", "uk1", etc.

apikey.description: a valid api key for your user account.

actions.title: _method_campaignUpdate.get
actions.description: Update just about any setting for a campaign that has not been sent.

cid.description: The Campaign Id to update.

name.description: For items in the options array, this will be that parameter's name (subject, from_email, etc.). Additional parameters will be that option name (content, segment_opts). "type_opts" will be the name of the type - rss, auto, trans, etc.

value.description: For items in the options array, this will be that parameter's value. For additional parameters, this is the same value passed to them.

dc.description: the portion after the dash in your api key. e.g. "us1", "us2", "uk1", etc.

apikey.description: a valid api key for your user account.
